string.text: The base loyalty of cities to the owner.
Days until the city's loyalty to the new owner changes.
The amount by which loyalty increases when the owner is in town.
Needed loyalty which is required for the city's obedience to the owner.
The time before another revolt can arise in the same faction.
The base size of the revolting army, which gets spawned.
This multiplier gets multiplied by the towns prosperity to add the amount to the base army size.
Enables/Disables the mechanics for Imperial Loyalty.
The amount of renown a imperial clan will loose after a revolt against them had success.
Does the mechanic affects the player as well.
Enables/Disables the mechanics for Minor Factions.
The amount of renown a minor faction will get after they successful revolted.
Enables/Disables the Revolts mechanics for Lucky Nation.
A random lucky nation from all possible kingdoms.
Civil War factions inherit the wars of their origin kingdom.
When relationship between the Lord and his King deteriorate above this threshold, he will stop willing to plot.
When relationship between the Lord and his King deteriorate below this threshold, there is a chance he will start plotting to overthrow him.
Base chance to become a plotter before all other factors are taken into account.
Increases chance of becoming a Plotter based on whether a lordâ€™s friends are also plotting.
Increases chance of becoming a Plotter when the Lord and Vassal are dishonorable.
Base chance for the Plot Leader to declare War on liege before all other factors are taken into account.
Decreases chance of declaring a war when the Lord and Vassal are generosity and mercy.
The amount by which relations will change (positive and negative) between lords based upon the Civil War faction they choose to be a part of.
Multiplier for relations change between lords and faction leaders.
Enables/Disables the output of detailed information.
Seeing you spend time at {SETTLEMENT}, your subjects feel more loyal to you.
The people of {SETTLEMENT} seem to be content.
Flames of Revolt are slowly stirring in {SETTLEMENT}.
People are content with the current rule.
Many are inspired by tales of revolts in the kingdom.
Many are inspired by events at {SETTLEMENT}.
Some talk of raising banners of their homeland.
The people of this town had revolted recently and don't wish to spill blood again.
After hearing of blood spilled in {SETTLEMENT} citizens are afraid of revolting.
